SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Cerebral arterial gas embolism is a potentially life-threatening event
Intraarterial air can occlude blood flow directly or cause thrombosis
Sclerotherapy is an extremely rare cause of cerebral arterial gas embolism

METHOD: Case-report RESULTS: A 38-year-old female suffered acute onset of a left middle cerebral artery (LMCA) syndrome with an NIH stroke score of 11 approximately 10 min after lower extremity sclerotherapy
CT angiogram demonstrated LMCA intraarterial air
Patient fully recovered after hyperbaric oxygen treatment with complete resolution of intraarterial air
However, thrombus replaced intraarterial air despite anticoagulation with heparin
CONCLUSION: We provide radiological evidence of hyperbaric oxygen therapy resolving intraarterial air but also demonstrate the thrombogenic potential of this procedural complication
